project.projectName: Australia AI Guardrails – Ethical Product Lifecycle Integration

overview.purpose: Embed best-practice guardrails for ethical, safe AI development & deployment aligned to Australia's proposed mandatory & voluntary standards.
overview.scope: Define, audit, and implement AI lifecycle governance processes across design, development, deployment, monitoring.

mandatoryGuardrails.applicability: High-risk AI systems for both developers and deployers

voluntaryStandard.recommendation: Early adoption ahead of formal regulation

phases.name: Discover & Align Voluntary Standard
phases.goal: Review and align current internal AI policies to the 10 voluntary guardrails.

phases.name: Map to Proposed Mandatory Guardrails
phases.goal: Interpret the 10 proposed mandatory guardrails and map organisational obligations.

phases.name: Governance & Process Design
phases.goal: Design or update governance workflows (oversight, risk management, transparency, record-keeping).

phases.name: Implementation & Training
phases.goal: Deploy policies and tools, train teams and integrate into product lifecycle.

phases.name: Pilot & Compliance Assessment
phases.goal: Run pilot AI deployments, perform conformity assessments, iterate governance as needed.

alignmentFeatures.earlyLifecycleIntegration: Focus on design, governance, testing, deployment, and monitoring from the outset
alignmentFeatures.ethicalLegalAlignment: Maps and operationalises both the voluntary and proposed mandatory guardrails
alignmentFeatures.governanceAuditPreparedness: Designed to capture audit logs, conformity assessments, governance entries, and transparency
alignmentFeatures.iterationFriendly: Piloting phase included to reflect evolving regulation and compliance mechanisms
alignmentFeatures.traceabilityAccountability: Incorporates oversight, record-keeping, right to challenge, bias mitigation, human control
